website_summaries.verdict: Performs well at a fraction of the cost of name-brand vests.  Lightweight and packable.
pros: Quilted and water-resistant, this vest has a durable nylon shell and lining, and duck down and feather insulation
Stand-up collar and elasticized arm holes provide extra warmth
cons: Too thin for regular winter use

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and stylish!!!
customer_reviews.text: This vest is amazing! Just as good as a brand name but a fraction of the cost. The collar comes up around the back of the neck and does a great job keeping you warm in cool weather. The front inside and outside pockets are conveniently located and the outside pockets are zippered for added security. The vest isn't bulky and so far no issues with losing the down feathers. One thing to note is these run large. I originally ordered an XL but had to return it for a large. I am 6'3" 250 and wear a 38" waist pants. I would advise ordering a size down unless you like your clothes super baggy.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Samut

customer_reviews.title: LOVING AMAZON ESSENTIALS PRODUCTS, SO FAR!!!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this vest. I bought the hooded long sleeve version for women and love mine. My only request is for Amazon to source better shell fabric, because eventually, with regular wear and washing, the down feathers start coming through the fabric. And YES! I'd pay $5 more for both items if Amazon upgraded the fabric!
customer_reviews.author: riverashopperny

customer_reviews.title: I loved this vest, but it has changed
customer_reviews.text: I bought a black version of the vest in Feb 2018, I love it, I went back to purchase another one, but a few things have changed. They only make small and large, no more XL, M, etc. why? I bought XL and it fits perfectly. Also, I loved the black, why doesn't it exist anymore? Amazon now seems to focus on the puffer vest with nylon filling (which is similar to northface, patagonia etc. the national brands rarely have down. That vest still has all the sizes and colors but the down vest no longer exists as it used to. Too bad!!
customer_reviews.author: Paul Ricard

customer_reviews.title: Good product but runs large
customer_reviews.text: The Mrs and I have been wearing these for a year now - good product but the mens runs large. Even with a thick hoodie underneath it is just a tab bit too large. The quality appears good - minor issues with zipper sticking or snagging detract from a higher score. One time the zipper stuck with the outer shell and took me 30 minutes to work out gently trying not tear the it. For reference only I have a Eddie Bauer down vest that I have not had any issues with. The Mrs vest fits more accurately but same zipper issues.
customer_reviews.author: Doc

customer_reviews.title: Good value. Not available in tall size which is ...
customer_reviews.text: Fit as expected. Good value. Not available in tall size which is what I needed. 6'5" , length to my waist. Pros: cost, packs down small, repuffs with short shaking, fit is comfortable, arm holes allow for movement with little heat loss, deep pockets. Cons: no waist drawstring, no tall sizes, zipper pulls small if wearing gloves. Would recommend and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: richard reeder

customer_reviews.title: It is thin like the name brand ones but keeps him so warm
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift for my husband. He typically likes name brands but I couldn't bring myself to buy this same vest for more than double the amount just to have a name brand on the outside. Turns out he loves it! It is thin like the name brand ones but keeps him so warm. Everytime he wears it, he says how much he likes it. The only negative is that little feathers stick to his shirts from the inside of the vest.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Hedges

customer_reviews.title: Nice vest
customer_reviews.text: This is nice to wear if you want to have something warm to wear but get overheated easily. I've been wearing it about every other day since X-mas. I have not noticed any stray threads and the zipper seams to be of high quality. I love the outer pockets and inside pockets, they are nice and deep. I have not washed them yet so I can't say how they will hold up afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: michael kang

customer_reviews.title: Lighy and easy to pack.  Comfortable and warm.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this vest. Very light and warm. Only reason I gave it 4 stars was it is not of same quality of the more expensive options. But for an every day use item it works great and the price paid was great. Love that I can pack it into pouch provided and stuff into my backpack.
customer_reviews.author: KAL In GilbertAZ

customer_reviews.title: good value. "L" fits 44L well
customer_reviews.text: Good value in a highly compressible down vest. I'm 6'4" 200 lbs and wear a 44L sport coat. The size "L" fits perfectly including torso length. This vest is in the modern style so thinner and not so puffy as the down vests from the 1970's.
customer_reviews.author: Someone interested in science

customer_reviews.title: Not for Arizona summer weather!
customer_reviews.text: I just got it today and love it so far. Our temp outside was 106 degrees today, so I didn't wear it outside, but it fits nicely and looks well made. I look forward to wearing it in cold weather.
customer_reviews.author: Norman Hodge
